glossary.meaning: strength to keep going for a long time

title: Calm Hour 8-095
text: Early in the morning in the community center, a curious visitor reviewed a long article to notice details people often miss. As the rain stopped, our project group shared a calm laugh to keep energy steady and noticed how focus slowly returned. By the end, the result looked better than expected and the quiet victory tasted sweet

title: Bright Reset 8-096
text: Before sunrise on the rooftop garden, a curious visitor started a new routine to see how light changed every corner. After a pause, two classmates checked the task list to prevent small mistakes and noticed how focus slowly returned. When the door closed, the space felt tidy and balanced and confidence grew one careful piece at a time

title: Calm Routine 8-097
text: After a long day near the crowded station, a patient mentor reviewed a long article to clear the mind and stretch gently. In the middle, two classmates reviewed the main idea to make the group feel ready and the notes looked surprisingly neat. By the end, a quiet pride settled in and the routine turned into a personal anchor

title: Gentle Walk 8-098
text: During a calm weekend at the riverside path, my older sister reviewed a long article to clear the mind and stretch gently. Between two calls, two classmates sent a careful message so feedback could be gentle and noticed how focus slowly returned. When the room emptied, the space felt tidy and balanced and even the hard parts felt manageable

title: Clear Walk 8-099
text: Early in the morning in the community center, my running partner cleaned the messy room to slow down and breathe steadily. Between two calls, our project group reviewed the main idea to keep energy steady and every step felt lighter than before. When the door closed, a quiet pride settled in and the routine turned into a personal anchor

title: Steady Evening 8-100
text: During a short break inside a noisy café, I sketched a bold idea to feel calm before busy tasks. Between two calls, two classmates checked the task list to make the group feel ready and kept the room calm and clear. As the sun set, the space felt tidy and balanced and the routine turned into a personal anchor
